newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate down to 11.1 pct from 11.9.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate down to 11.1 pct from 11.9.

text.p: The Croatian average lending rate dropped to 11.1 percent on Tuesday from the previous 11.9 percent in somewhat livelier trade.
The daily volume was put at 35.4 million kuna, leaving an extra 16.6 million on the supply side.
Fresh loans accounted for 25.9 million kuna, mostly call money at a weighted rate of 10.6 percent.
Interbank term loans were struck at 12-17 percent, depending on maturity. Savings banks pay one point higher.
Insurers rolled over 9.5 million kuna at a steady nine percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Wednesday weaker at 6.1315 against the dollar and 3.5775 to the German mark. -- Sandra Kalogjera, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
